disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Sunday 15 May to end of Monday 16 May GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: The weather for Sunday and Monday is forecast to be cloudy with likely rain.<br/><br/>A mostly 'clean' Atlantic air feed with good dispersion of local emissions should ensure low levels of pollution throughout the weekend.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Tuesday 17 May to end of Tuesday 17 May GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: A warm day for Tuesday with temperatures into the mid-20s by the afternoon as south-east England is affected by a southerly air feed arriving from the Bay of Biscay.<br/><br/>The formation of ground-level ozone is often associated with warm weather as  long-range precursor pollutants react photochemically with local emissions in strong sunshine. An ozone episode is not though expected on Tuesday due to increasing cloud cover in the afternoon and a lack of precursor pollutants on the 'clean' southerly breeze.   <br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>
